title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: South Park, woods, night. Six boys look at a tree stump surrounded by litter. They are Jimmy, Toke, Craig, Clyde, Kyle, and Cartman. Kyle is carrying a black trash bag. On the stump is a marijuana joint and some paper

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Throw it away, Clyde!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I'm not gonna touch it. You throw it away.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: What's going on?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Some high schoolers left their marijuana cigarette behind. Uh we have to throw it away before some kids find it or something.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: So throw it away.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Nobody wants to touch it.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: What if the residue gets on our hands and it leads to harder drugs like those commercials say.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah, didn't you see that commercial where it says that if you have pot you could become a terrorist?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: And the commercial where the two kids have pot and the one kids shoots the other. Harmless?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: You guys, those commercials are just exaggerations.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: How do you know? None of us had ever had any drugs before.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well, I did Ecstacy once.  Me and my girlfriend took it and we stayed up all night having... sex.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: ...Where did you have sex with her?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: In her... va-vagina.  Thank you, thank you. What a terrific audience.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: It's just a stupid plant that makes you dumb. Touching it won't hurt you.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Then you throw it away, smartass.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Fine, I will.  There, see? I touched marijuana. I'm not a terrorist, I didn't shoot anybody, and I don't feel like doing more drugs now. No big deal.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: South Park, night. To the sound of dramatic music, lightning relentlessly flashes all over town. Stan's house is shown as lightning strikes it. In the living room Stan watches "The Osbournes" with his grandfather. Ozzy is shown in his living room talking to his kids

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: You kids  don't  around with your  mom!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Dad, we ing can't! It's a big ick a

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Stan, what did I tell you about watching The Osbournes?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Aw, come on, Mom.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: It's going to make you retarded!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: It's just a show! It doesn't have any fucking effect on me, for fuck's sake!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh goody. Now we can watch the news.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: In other news, South Park police are still looking for a craaazy man who terrorized the town one hour ago.  The man claimed to be from the future and ran naked through the city streets screaming "The past! The past! Oh my God, it's the past!" Which is what one would expect someone in the future to yell.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh my God, it's the past!  Oh, whoa man, it's you!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Who are you?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: It's me, Mom, your son Stan.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Who is it, Sharon?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Dad!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Dad?? Look! We don't know you and you don't know us! Just go away before we call the police!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Who the fuck is is, Mom and Dad?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: No way, it's me from the past!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I'm me from the past?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: No, I'm you from the future!  Oh man, this is so messed up.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Okay, we've had enough!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Your name's Randy Marsh, you're a geologist, and you don't like chicken. Mom, your maiden name is Kimble and you have a scar on your left knee from when you slipped in the swimming pool.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Randy, what's going on?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I don't know.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Dude, just let me talk to you for like, five minutes. After that I'll bail.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: The Marsh dining room. The naked man is now dressed in street clothes and seated at the head of the table. He's emjoying a beer and regular cigarette. The others look dazed and confused at the man as he recounts his memories

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I can still remember when I was five and you both found that squirrel I'd been keeping in the closet and, you let me keep it for another week and then it ran away but... I know that's just what you told me. I know that Mom had actually let it out.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: How could he possibly know all that unless... he is our son from the future.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: But why are you back in this time with us, son?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I have no idea, man. I was just about to go asleep in an alley behind the crackhouse,  and I shot up a little heroin, and then this electrical storm started. Next thing I knew I was running around in my own past, man. I thought... I was just tripping, but then I came down and I was still here. Oh, dude, it's so bizarre!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh dude, I should have never touched that marijuana!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Stan, whatever's happened, we going to help you.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: That's right. We're a family no matter what time shift.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Thanks. Can I get another beer?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: You must be exhausted. Why don't you get some sleep?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: That'd be killer. Where can I crash?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well I'm sure Stan wouldn't mind his room, would you, Stan?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: What?? I have to share my room with my future self?? Oh no!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Here we are, face to face, "My Future Self -n- Me"

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Stan and Future Stan stroll down a road. Future Stan has a beer

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Stop it!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: So much alike, and yet so different

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: No!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: One of them's messy, the other one's clean!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Stan's future self turns off the light while Stan looks pissed off

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
role: Gettin' along isn't always easy, sometimes we disagree

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Stan's future self brushes his teeth as Stan stands next to him, avoiding him. Future Stan spits his frothy toothpaste into the sink

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Quit it!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: But in the end we know we're good for each other

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: both Stans eat cereal, but the future Stan has trouble pouring milk into his bowl. It splashes out of the bowl along with some cereal. Stan just buries his face in his hands in frustration

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
role: Two peas in a pod, Future Self -n- Me

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Now they have separate beds. Stan turns the light out and tries to sleep. Future Stan reaches over to turn it on. Stan moves to turn it on, and they fight over the switch until one of them sleeps

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Bus stop, next day. Stan arrives with future Stan

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Hey guys.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Hey.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Whoa, Kyle and Cartman! It's so cool to see you guys.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Who's this asshole?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: This is my future self. He came during the electrical storm last night and is caught in a time matrix. He's me when I'm 32.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Wow. That's pretty cool.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Then how does he know our names?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: 'Cause, artard, he's Stan from the future. He knows everything Stan knows.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Ohhh. Wait. Stan becomes this douchebag?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah, I spent a lot of my teenage years on a slow downward spiral experimenting with drugs and alcohol.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Shut up, Cartman!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: That is so awesome!! Thank you God! Oh praise God!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Hey, what happens to me in the future?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh, I don't know. You guys stayed away from drugs, so you're okay. I just lost touch with you after I was sent to Juvi Hall in 2006.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Juvi Hall!  Stan's a loser! Stan's a loser!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: God-damnit!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: South Park Elementary, after school, Garrison's classroom. Stan and Butters are seated next to each other, and there are no other kids around

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Thanks for staying after school and tutoring me, Butters.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Uh well, sure thing, Stan. Eh, how come you care about schoolwork all of a sudden?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I told you, I can't stand my future self. I have to do whatever I can to not become a loser like him.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well, studying is the golden key to the imposing door of success.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I just can't stand having my future self around all the time! It's driving me crazy!  Maybe if I get smarter I won't become him and I won't have to share my room!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I know what you mean. I hate having my future self around, too.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah, it's like everything I do, he... Wait a minute, what'd you say?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I said, I know how you feel. My life has gone completely downhill ever since my future self moved in. I hate him! All he ever wants to do is watch Becker. And that show is so stupid.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Dude, how long has your future self been around?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh. I guess it's been around four months now.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Four months?? And you never told anybody that you were living with yourself in the future??

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Nobody asked.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Where is he now?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Probably watching Becker.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters' house, afternoon. A future Butters is watching TV and eating chips at the sofa

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: My name is T. Becker. The T stand for Terrific.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: See, here he is. Future Butters. Future self, this is my good friend,-

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Stan! Sure I remember you. Yep. Wearing that puff-ball hat like always.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh, hello boys. Future Butters, it's time to take your liver medicine.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Liver medicine?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah. My future self has a bad kidney from all the drinkin' he did in high school.  Amd I need to learn to behave myself!  Hey! Where are you going, Stan?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Stan's house, moments later. Stan rushes into his room with Butters in tow

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Alright, where is that sonofabitch's wallet?!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Wha-, what are you lookin' for, huh Stan?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters, don't you think it's a little bit of a coincidence that both your future self and my future self got caught in a mexterdexed time plane?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well they both got the same teacher for homeroom, too, but you didn't say anything then.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Here it is.  It has to be something eh... Wait, what's this?  This expires in two thousand two. Why does he have this in his wallet?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I don't follow.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Three four five one Colfax Avenue. Come on, Butters.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh! Are we out for an adventure?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Denver, night. A bus drives up to a curb on the seedy street, then takes off. Stan and Butters walk down the street

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Here it is. Motivation Corp.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I don't think we're supposed to go in there, Stan. Maybe we should go adventurin' somewhere else.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters, part of being on an adventure is you go places you're not supposed to go.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh. Well, you're good at adventurin', huh Stan?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Motivation Corp., interior. Stan and Butters look down a long hallway. Stan notices a window and looks in. Several workers are at their computers matching kids up with actors who are to portray their futures selves

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: What the hell is going on here?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: It should take about a month to achieve the results you want.  Well, Mr. and Mrs. Brooks, I think you're going to be very pleased with the results.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: We sure hope so. We just don't know how to talk to our son about drugs.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well now you won't have to! Ah, here he is. This is Josh Casher. He'll be playing the role of your future son.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Nice to meet you, "Mom and Dad."

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: My goodness, he does look a little like Kevin.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yes, and he knows all your family history and every detail of your house. And he's worked up quite a future for your son.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I'm going to tell him that I dropped out of school and went to prison for eight years, where I was sodomized. In the ass.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Woohoo, that should get Kevin to stay clear of drugs.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Heh it sure should, heh.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Alright, then we'll put the fake news report out on Tuesday night. Make sure your son is watching the Channel 4 News.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh, and that's when uh you'll fake the electrical storm as well?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Motivation Corp. takes care of everything. Just follow these simple scripts when your actor arrives.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: "Listen to me, you crazy person, there's no way you can be from the future." Oh this is going to be fun.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Motivation Corp., interior. Stan hurries out of there with Butters close behind.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I can't believe it! It's all a scam!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah, I can't believe it!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: They've all been lying to us this whole time!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: This whole time! I wonder if my future self knows anything about this?  Hey, maybe my future self remembers this happening, a-and can shed some light on this subject.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters, don't you get it?! Those assholes aren't our future selves! Our parents hired them to make us more motivated!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Eh, but then why did they come back to the past

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: They didn't come back to the past, you dumbass, they're actors!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh... Oohhhh.  But that's like they're lyin'

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: It is lying, Butters. Your parents lied to you and my parents lied to me! Get it!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Ohhh, that makes me angry! Why, if Professor Chaos were here he'd make everyone pay!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Who's that?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: You know, Professor Chaos, bringer of destruction and disorder!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: What?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Follow me back home, Stan. It's time I let you in on a horrible s-secret!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters' house, later. An upper light is on. Butters leads Stan into his bedroom.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Wait right here, Stan. I warn you: you may not like what you're about to see.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: We have to teach our parents a lesson! Show them they can't just play with our emotions like that!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Now you know my terrible secret!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: ...You're gay?  It's fine if you're gay, Butters. I don't care.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Huh? Naw, I'm Professor Chaos, Stan.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: But we have to teach our parents a lesson, Butters! We're running away! Help me find the perfect place to run away to!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Mm. Uhm, maybe I used a little too much silver.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Stan's room, next day. Stan and Butters are on the floor. Butters is reading the newspaper as Stan watches on.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: How about this? Winter Farm. It looks kinda nice.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: No, we gotta run away somewhere warm.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Wow, look at this, Stan.  "Are you sick of your parents? Do you want revenge for something they've done to you? Call the Parental Revenge Center of Western America for a free con-sul-ta-tion. Results guaranteed."

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Dude, I didn't know there was such a thing.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Hey look, somebody lost their pet.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Uh, hi, is this the Parental Revenge Center of Western America?  Ah I'm really pissed off at my parents and I wanna impose swift and horrible revenge upon them?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Look, you can make your weiner bigger in just three weeks.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh really? Oh, okay, uh where are you located, please?  Great, uumm, can I come by tomorrow?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: This lady'll massage your weiner for ninety-five dollars. Well that's a pretty good deal.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Eleven o'clock is great. Thank you. That was easy! I just have to go to their office and they'll help me figure out how to get back at my parents!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Hah-hey, I wanna get revenge on my douchebag parents, too.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Fine, then you can come with me.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Hooray!  And then we can make our weiners bigger, and have the lady massage them.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: South Park, commercial district. Stan and Butters run down the street and turn the corner into an alley. Stan checks the address

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I guess this is it.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Parental Revenge Center of Western America. The headquarters are quite shabby. What looks like computers and monitors are just cardboard boxes with crude drawings on them. Stan and Butters enter. They look around as they approach the main desk

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Uh hello, we're here about the revenge on our parents?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yes, come in, please.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Cartman??

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh, Stan, Butters, I didn't know it was you guys.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: What the hell are you doing here?!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I'm running a business, Stan. Are you my eleven o'clock?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: You're the Parental Revenge Center of Western America??

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: God-damnit, I knew this was too good to be true! Come on, Butters, let's go.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Eh, so, you don't want to make your parents suffer and pay for mistreating you, then?  Look, ah, I don't know what your parents did to you, but if you're here, I take it they pissed you off pretty good. Maybe you should at least ...hear what I have to offer?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh, sorry. I thought this was a legitimate business!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: That it is, I assure you. I started this business over three months ago from the ground up. I've beenhelping children get back at their parents ever since.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: How many parents have you exacted revenge upon?!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Craig's. a-and Clyde's. Oh and and Kyle's, but that was a freebie. Look, I run a legitimate business hre with state-of-the-art computers, charts, and technology. Look around you. I know how it feels to be really, really pissed off at your parents. And I will work hard, for you.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Our moms and dads lied to us about those future selves! It was just a trick to get us to not wanna try drugs or alcohol.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: God-damnit! See? This is exactly why I started this business. If a parent can't respect their child, than who can they respect, huh?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Listen! Parents understand one thing, and that's consequences. They need to see consequences from their actions, or else they'll never learn. What my company does is inflicts those consequences upon the parents in a very real and very direct way.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: How much is this going to cost us?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Eighteen thousand dollars.  How about just... three hundred and eighty seven easy payments of a hundred ninety nine, ninety five.  How about five bucks?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Motivation Corp., day.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: So, everything is working out with your future actor? Your son seems to be responding.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I think he's pretty scared alright.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: It's just a little weird having people lying to our boy like this.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well, you know what us ultra-liberals say, when it comes to children and drugs, lies are OK. The ends justify the means. We'll take smoking, for instance. The truth is there's no hard evidence that second-hand smoke can kill but, we believe it's okay to lie about it as long as it gets people to stop smoking.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well that makes sense.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: So it is with everything here at Motivation Corp. It's okay for us to lie and tell kids that all marijuana supports terrorism. Or that... one pill of Ecstacy is gonna kill them. It's not necessarily true, but the ends justify the means.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well I think when this is all over, our son is gonna thank us.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Parental Revenge Center of Western America. Cartman prepares to lay out his plans for Stan and Butters. His cap is gone, as is the egg-shell chair.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Okay, Butters, let's start with you. I thnk I've found a great way to get revenge on your parents. Just... tell me if I'm going in the right direction here.  What we're going to do, Butters, is we're going to wait for your parents to leave the house, and then, smear all the walls... with poop.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Hwuhh. That'll make them awful sore.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Now, I want you to take a look at some of these poop swatches.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Poop- poop swatches?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Poop comes in a lot of varieties, Butters. I wanna find the perfect one, tailored to your revenge on your parents.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Hey, that's neato, huh, Stan?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Now, personally, I like the baby green. But I also think the classic brown would go nicely with your house.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Wow, Eh eh you sure are a p-professional, Eric! I don't know which swatch I like best.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well, y-you know what we could do, uh, uh Butters, is go with the baby green in the living room, and then maybe a classic brown, or even a nut-n-corn crunch in your parents' bedroom.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well that sounds good.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Okay, well let's do that then. That looks nice.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Hooray!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Alright, now, Stan. For you I've put together a really nice design. I feel your parents were a bit more cocky about lying to you and your revenge needs to reflect that. So what I wanna to is put a note on your parents' door, telling them I'm the counselor from the school.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: The note will inform them that a problem has come up and they need to see me right-away, back at my office.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Your parents will drive all the way out to the school and discover that no meeting is actually taking place.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: And while they're gone, we're gonna smear all their walls with poop.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Wow! Neato!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: That's not neato, that sucks.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: What?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: You're gonna smear Butters' parent's walls with poop. I thought his revenge was unique and customized!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Poop-smearing is the hot ticket right now, Stan, and... have you seen the poop swatches.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Dude, that's not extreme enough! My parents aren't gonna learn their lesson from having some crap smeared on their walls! I want them to see what they did was wrong! I want them to have them to admit that they lied to me!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Okay, okay, fine. I I just, I just, ...my first idea. That's why we have these consultations.  Okay, okay, lemme, lemme see here. Uh. Oh wait, oh this is nice. How about this: uh, we'll lure your parents out of the house, and then we'll kill them. Uh, we'll cut them up into little pieces and feed them to the dog

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Dude!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Extreme enough for you? How's Wednesday?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: No, that's too extreme!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well first it's not extreme enough and then it's too extreme; where do you want it?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Just forget it, Cartman! You don't know what you're doing!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I'm a professional, suh!  Don't worry about it, Butters. You're gonna be a hundred percent satisfied.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: The Marsh house, day. All the Marshes are at the dining room table eating tacos and chips

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Hey future self.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yes, former self?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: You know that thing that I kept hidden in the hold in the wall for two years that I've never told anybody about? You know, the thing that I take out of the shoebox every night before I go to sleep?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh, uh...

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: You must know what I'm talking about.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Sure uh, uh,  oh man, could you all excuse me for a second? I think I'm gonna crap my pants.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Uh, Stan,  don't you think you're upsetting your future self a little?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah, Stan, don't be so hard on yourself.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Mom, Dad, I don't think that guy is from the future.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh. You. You don't?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: No.  You know what I think? I think this is all an elaborate hoax!  And I think that whoever is doing it doesn't have very much respect for me!  See, the best way to try to motivate somebody is by being direct with them, to be honest with them. I think the whole futre self thing is a lie, and lies are never the right way to get your message across.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well, you know what I think, Stan?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: What?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I think he IS from the future.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah, he must be.  It's like, I jsut feel he's our son, you know?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Right. That's mother's intuition; you can't argue with that. No, Stan, I think the only way you're gonna get of him is by staying clear of drugs and alcohol.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Right.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters' house, day. There's a Hispanic crew in the house painting the walls with two kinds of poop colors. The furniture is covered. Cartman enters and walks around the living room

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Okay, very nice, very nice. Oh wait, uh, God-damnit! Felipe!  The classic brown poop is supposed to go in the parents' bedroom! The living room is supposed to be all baby green poop!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: ¿Qué? ¿La caca no esta aquí?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: ¡La caca de moreno no es aquí! ¡Aquí es verde, señor! ¡Es verde! ¡Arriba arriba!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: ¡Sí, sí señor!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Sí, gracias. ¿Y tú?  ¡Carlos! ¡Carlos, no! We want a textured effect on the nut-n-corn crunch poop. That's why we spackle with the sponge.  See? Spackle gently. Lo marrado. Gently, see? Marrado.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Sí. Marrado.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Marrado. Spectacularrr.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Sí.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: God, it's so hard to find good help. Ah! Butters, like what you're seeing so far?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Boy, it sure is stinky in here!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah, well, three hundred gallons of poop isn't gonna smell like a garden, Butters. But I think it's coming together real nice.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Look, eh, Eric, I've been thinkin', my parents are gonna be awful sore and I don't think-

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yes, well, I've done my job, haven't I?  ¡Pepite, Pepite, no! No come la taco la trabajar!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: The Marsh house, night. Randy and Sharon talk with the future Stan

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yes, well, it's hard to find work in commercials, so I ended up-

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh, Stan!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh, dude, how's it goin', man? Ey, you wanna go upstaris and play hide and go seek?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Hide and go seek, huh?!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah, Stan, why don't you go upstairs and play with yourself?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I don't believe that he's my future self!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah, but we can't be sure, so we'd better assume he is and never try that first marijuana cigarette, huh?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: No, I actually have a way to be sure. I'm going to cut off my hand. If he is my future self, then his hand will disappear.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: S-stanley you don't need to do that. He-he is your future self.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: But I have to know for sure.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Don't be silly, Stan. You don't wanna go through life without one of your hands.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Maybe it's the hand I smoked that first joint with. Here I go. I'm gonna do it.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Stan...

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yes?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Uh... nothing. Go ahead.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Randy!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: AAAH!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: AAAHHH! Oh my God! Look!  What? His hand did disappear! He is you from the future!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh, Jesus Christ! Help me!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: That's weird, because I really didn't cut off my hand. It was fake.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Uh..  Look, it was fake in the future, too.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Looks like you'd better really watch out for marijuana, huh Stan?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters' house. Cartman stands with his crew behind him, their work finished.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well Butters, I hope you like the work. I'm sure your parents will be plenty pissed off.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Uh, and after my parents get angry, uh how do we get the poop off the walls?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Ooo, ah, that's a different company. Oh! Someone's here! We'd better run out the back! Pepite! Carlos! ­¡Vamonos!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Uh but Cartman! Wait!  Oh Christmas!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh, Stan!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters, we've go-! Oh, God, it smells in here.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah, well, three hundred gallons of poop isn't gonna smell like a garden.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters, we're running away!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: We are?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Our parents are never gonna admit what they did was wrong, and they're never gonna change!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: What the hell is this?!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh my God, our house!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh Geez, ah, I'm gonna get it now

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters! Do you have an explanation for this?!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh, not really sir, I just uh...

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Wait a minute. Chris, don't you see? This might be our fault.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: What, uh-? My God. You're right, Linda. This is what we get for deceiving our son.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Huh?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Butters, listen. The whole future self thing, well, it was a dirty fib.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: We just so desperately wanted you to never try drugs that we used a big scare tactic instead of ...telling you the truth.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: We though the ends justified the means, but they don't. They just... don't, son!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: We're sorry, baby.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Get the fuck out of here.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Stan! Stan! Oh. Okay, uh, you you might be wondering why Butters has a future self, too.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yes, well, eh you see, son, the time matrix pulled in more people from the future.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Aw, stop it, you guys! I know all about Motivation Corp.! All I've been trying to get you guys to do is admit that you lied to me!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh... Well... Son, we've just been trying to make sure you know how dangerous drugs like pot are.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I've been told a lot of things about pot, but I've come to find out a lot of those things aren't true! So I don't know what to believe!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well, Stan, the truth is marijuana probably isn't gonna make you kill people, and ...it most likely isn't gonna fund terrorism, but... Well son, pot makes yuu feel fine with being bored and... It's when you're bored that you should be learning some new skill or discovering some new science or... being creative. If you smoke pot you may grow up to find out that you aren't good at anything.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: I really, really wish you just would have told me that from the beginning.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: He's right. If we use lies and exaggerations to keep kids off drugs, then they're never gonna believe anything we tell them

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well, there's only one person I can blame. Motivation Corp.!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Outside Motivation Corp., day. Randy, Sharon, Stan, and Cartman look at the building and listen at the voices coming out of it

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh God, who smeared crap all over our walls?! Oh Jesus, it smells! Oh!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: You really did a nice job, Eric.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Yeah, I gotta admit. You really came through. Thank you. I thought the hangover black went really nice in the lobby.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Well here, Eric, I baked you a huge box of cookies as a present.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Thanks. But you know, all this talk about future selves has made me think, maybe I should ...take better care of myself. I mean, maybe I should think about who I'm going to become.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Atta boy, Eric. You've made the right choice.

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Who the hell are you?

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Haha, it's me, Cartman! You from the future.  I came back to tell you that this is the day you turn it all around. You stop eating junk food and you start studying harder, you stay away from drugs and alcohol and you become CEO of your own time-travel company!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Oh wow, really? That's so awesome! Now I'll really work to be successful!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Right on!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: Go have sex with yourself, asshole! I'm not that stupid! Just for that, I'm gonna spend my whole childhood eating what I waunt, and doin' drugs when I waunt!  Whatevuh! I'll do what I waunt!

title: MY FUTURE SELF N ME
text: No, wait!  Oh, God-damnit!
